title: Getting started with AndyWebsite
text: can launch Shiny app running following command R console: opens HAI Dashboard – German PPS 2011 : Cases (interactive): total cases infection type, rate per 1,000 patients hover. Length Infection: distribution (days) chosen infection type. & Read: glossary + interpretation notes.

title: Getting started with AndyWebsite
text: app uses objects provided BHAI: num_survey_patients: total number patients surveyed PPS. population: national population (2011). length_of_stay: mean hospital length stay (days). num_hai_patients: named vector case counts infection type (HAP, SSI, BSI, UTI, CDI). loi_pps: list vectors length infection (days) per type. Note: prevalence-oriented summaries point-prevalence survey (PPS), incident cases time.

previous_headings: How to read the app’s outputs
title: Getting started with AndyWebsite
text: Infection - HAI type: HAP (Hospital-Acquired Pneumonia), SSI (Surgical Site Infection), BSI (Bloodstream Infection), UTI (Urinary Tract Infection), CDI (Clostridioides difficile Infection). Cases: number surveyed patients identified infection type (num_hai_patients). Rate per 1,000 patients: Standardized rate 1000 * cases / num_survey_patients, enabling fair comparisons. Days: Infection duration (days) patient. Values come loi_pps[[type]] (statistical draws used burden estimation). Count: number infections lasted exactly number days.

previous_headings: How to read the app’s outputs
title: Getting started with AndyWebsite
text: Cases (interactive) Taller bars = prevalent infection types PPS sample. hover tooltip shows rate per 1,000 patients standardise across groups. Length Infection histogram shows long infections lasted. Peaks low days ⇒ many infections resolved quickly; long right tail means subset prolonged duration. Read prevalence (common) together duration (long) reason potential burden.

what: Interactive Data Exploration and Analysis Dashboard
title: Interactive Data Exploration and Analysis Dashboard
text: AndyWebsite created Andy Tran part ETC5523 Assignment 4 project. purpose package extend previous analyses Assignments 2 3 using data BHAI package build interactive, user-friendly Shiny dashboard. dashboard allows users explore healthcare-associated infection (HAI) data German PPS 2011 dataset, visualising infection prevalence duration interactively. goal let users interact data better understand relationships conclusions drawn earlier analyses. Website: https://etc5523-2025.github.io/assignment-4-packages--shiny-apps-Jakey-vn/

what: Launch the HAI Dashboard (German PPS 2011) — launch_app
title: Launch the HAI Dashboard (German PPS 2011) — launch_app
text: Starts Shiny application bundled package. app provides interactive overview healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) German point-prevalence survey (PPS) 2011, including total cases infection type distributions length infection.

title: Launch the HAI Dashboard (German PPS 2011) — launch_app
Launch the HAI Dashboard (German PPS 2011) — launch_app
Launch the HAI Dashboard (German PPS 2011) — launch_app
text: Cases (interactive) – Bar chart HAI cases type   hover tooltips showing standardized rate per 1,000 survey patients. Length Infection – Histogram infection durations (days)   selected infection type. \& Read – Plain-language descriptions fields,   definitions, interpretation guidance.

title: Launch the HAI Dashboard (German PPS 2011) — launch_app
text: Survey Patients: total patients included PPS snapshot. Population (2011): national population (context). Mean Length Stay: average hospital stay days.

title: Launch the HAI Dashboard (German PPS 2011) — launch_app
text: app uses objects BHAI example dataset german_pps_2011_repr runtime: num_survey_patients, population, length_of_stay, num_hai_patients, loi_pps. convenience table df_cases (cases rate per 1,000) derived inside app. instead ship precomputed data objects AndyWebsite, see ?df_cases, ?metrics, ?loi_by_type.
